messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: PUDDLES
messages.msgSnippet: that is so cool.  My kids love me best when I am weird (at least I think so).  My son loves it when I belch, or make weird faces.  My daughter loves it when I
messages.messageBody:
that is so cool. My kids love me best when I am weird
(at least I think so). My son loves it when I belch,
or make weird faces. My daughter loves it when I
speak "teenager" even though she says I embarass her.
They love it when we just have fun with them and I
think that is so important. Great mental piture, even
though I don't know what you look like. Thanks,
Christy
--- Ali Kat <sweetgypsiedncer@...> wrote:

>
> ************I'm 39 years old and still like to run
> through a puddle on occasion************
>
> one of Bekka's favorite things is when her mom gets
> "weird" and will jump, splash, and dance through
> puddles in the rain and singing (yup) "Singin' in
> the Rain" at the top of her lungs...
>
> Bekka tells me "Mamma, you are weird!" To which I
> reply, "Yup... That's my job." ;-)
>
>

messages.subject: Re: PUDDLES
messages.msgSnippet: ************I m 39  years old and still like to run through a puddle on  occasion************ one of Bekka s favorite things is when her mom gets weird and
messages.messageBody:
************I'm 39 years old and still like to run through a puddle on occasion************

one of Bekka's favorite things is when her mom gets "weird" and will jump, splash, and dance through puddles in the rain and singing (yup) "Singin' in the Rain" at the top of her lungs...

Bekka tells me "Mamma, you are weird!" To which I reply, "Yup... That's my job." ;-)
